title: Dopff Au Moulin 2013 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Notes of earth mix with notes of leafy apple on the nose, the dry, fresh palate continues in that earthy vein and finishes dry with a bruised apple flavor.

title: Emina 2013 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Compared to other 2013 Ribera wines, this is more lush and friendly on the nose. But on the palate, high acidity and hard tannins make their presence felt. Boysenberry flavors are followed by a wave of toasty oak, while dry tannins and a charred character define the finish.

title: Monmousseau NV Cuvée J.M. Rosé Brut Sparkling (Touraine)
description: Fresh, with the attractive cool feel that's typical of the Loire, this is a red currant and raspberry flavored wine. It is fruity, just lightly structured and with a fine tang of citrus to finish.

title: Klinker Brick 2013 Farrah Syrah (Lodi)
description: A strong and tasty oak component makes this full-bodied wine an attention-grabber, beginning with the toasted aromas, then complex and spicy flavors and firmly tannic texture. While the oakiness tamps down the fruit flavors, it does make it fun to drink.

title: Kössler 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This is bright and crisp, with aromas of hay, passion fruit and citrus. The tangy palate shows classic varietal flavors, including grapefruit, kiwi, honeydew melon and mineral alongside lively acidity.

title: Joleté 2014 Cuvée Select Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Good and spicy, this well-structured effort shows some lightly ripened flavors of rhubarb, raspberry and hard cherry candy. A streak of jalapeño pepper runs alongside, delivering impressive definition and length for the price.

title: Joseph Cattin 2014 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Muscat (Alsace)
description: An utterly seductive perfume of Muscat grape, honeysuckle and peach rises from the glass. The palate does not quite follow up this promise and adds a hint of sweetness to create a perfumed, light-bodied wine. Drink soon.

title: Irony 2014 Small Lot Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Light in the glass, this solidly priced bottling shows light vanilla, caramel sea salt, squeezed lemon and white peach on the plump and approachable nose. The palate sizzles with the chalky energy of pink-grapefruit peels, with poached-apple flavors laced across pithy texture and a steely elegance.

title: Mullineux 2014 Kloof Street Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: Ripe aromas of honeydew, orange creamsicle, grilled apple and almond are framed by a hint of fynbos on the nose of this accessible Chenin. The plush, round palate boasts notes of tangerine, apple flesh and pineapple that finish crisp and clean. Drink now–2018.

title: Muzic 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: The nose is at first rather shy but slowly reveals cut grass, kiwi, tomato leaf and tropical fruit. The svelte, vibrant palate offers grapefruit, raw white nectarine, sage and white pepper alongside racy acidity. A mineral note signals the close.

title: Falkenstein 2013 Val Venosta Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Cut grass, tomato vine and gooseberry aromas almost jump out of the glass. The tangy, racy palate offers grapefruit, papaya, a light kiwi note and a hint of mineral alongside brisk acidity.

title: Ferruccio Sgubin 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Tomato vine, elderberry flower, hay and dill aromas mingle on this crisp white. The vibrant palate delivers grapefruit, pineapple, celery and graphite accompanied by vibrant acidity. Nectarine backs up the finish.

title: Erath 2014 Oregon Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: If you are looking for a well-made Oregon Pinot Noir under $20, this is a good choice. Medium bodied, it offers well-ripened red and blue fruits, a lick of toast, well-built tannins, and a finishing streak of dark roasted coffee.

title: Fleur de California 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Muted aromatics blossom slowly around a lovely, lilting and shy expression of the variety, seared gently in acidity and a taste of green apple and tropical guava. The presence of oak is low and understated, allowing a light-bodied wine to remain fruity and pure.

title: Marco Felluga 2012 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, vanilla and a confectionary note lead the nose while the palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, butterscotch and walnut skin alongside bracing acidity.

title: Livon 2014 Braide Grande Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: You'll find aromas of beeswax, white flower and a whiff of orchard fruit on this fragrant white. The lively palate offers crisp apple, nectarine, toasted almond and mineral alongside bracing acidity.

title: Lobo 2013 Selecção Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: This is a dark, dense wine. It has concentrated tannins that are still dominant. The ripe fruit that is underneath will shortly reveal red berry and red currant freshness. This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is perfumed with a fresh, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: La Castellada 2009 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Fermented and aged in large Slavonian oak, this unusual, copper-colored wine opens with scents of wildflower, red berry, baking spice and a balsamic note. The spicy palate is linear and structured, showing ginger, cinnamon, tangerine zest and mineral but not much fruit richness. A white pepper note closes the finish.

title: Nieto Senetiner 2015 Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Tropical aromas of lychee and banana come with a varietally familiar note of bath soap. This is oily feeling, but with integrated acidity it isn't ponderous. Pithy citrus flavors are backed by a hint of bitterness, while the finish is juicy, a touch burning and tastes of nectarine and mango.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Riesling (Lisboa)
description: The wine has the correct texture and attractive perfumes for a delicate Riesling. The crisp apple and tight mineral flavors are light and floating. It's a surprising wine for the Lisbon region, but it works so well.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Verdelho (Lisboa)
description: This is a deliciously perfumed wine that is fresh and fruity with a fine, tight texture to add interest and give it shape. It takes advantage of the natural aromatic flavors of the grape to produce a wine that is both crisp and fragrant. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Vallado 2013 Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: With its typical perfumed fruit and firm tannins this is a ripe structured wine. It does suffer from the one-dimensional character that can come with a mono-varietal Touriga Nacional. That keeps the wine firm with good fruit although without great depth and complexity. Drink from 2017.

title: Peju 2014 Persephone Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Rich caramel and a substantive presence of oak overlay an otherwise fairly light-bodied, structured wine from an estate vineyard. It's packed in tropical elements and baked apple.

title: Peachy Canyon 2013 Incredible Red Zinfandel (California)
description: A stellar deal for the price, this wine shows plum, strawberry and asphalt on the nose, with a touch of clove-nutmeg spice. It's tart and dry, with dusty elderberry flavors on the palate, boosted by a touch of mint and a decent structure.

title: Quintet 2013 Ribbon Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Two bottles were tasted, with significant variation. The better bottle showed moderately ripe cherry fruit framed in chocolate and orange peel. A 50/50 mix of Pommard and Dijon 777 clones, this is best enjoyed soon.

title: RouteStock 2014 Route 99W Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Sporting a big burst of juicy cranberry fruit, this young wine, one of the first Pinots to be released from the 2014 vintage, is easy to like. There's nothing too fussy here, just tangy red fruit set against balanced acids and light tannins.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2013 Quinta do Côa Red (Douro)
description: The Côa Valley is in the far eastern end of the Douro vineyards, increasingly exciting for red wines. This wine, from organic vineyards, retains plenty of freshness with red berry fruits and tannins that are already well integrated. It is fruity, ripe and ready to drink now.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Tinto Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Packed with ripe fruits and soft tannins, this is a juicy, red fruit flavored wine. Although it is young with the fruity side right up front, it is really not a wine that needs to age for long. Enjoy the wine for its freshness and light touch of minerality.

title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2014 RK Riesling (Mosel)
description: While the nose is a touch savory and subdued, the palate of this off-dry Riesling boasts an abundance of sweet-tart apricot and peach flavors. Its sunny, simple demeanor is jolted by searing lemon-lime acidity that bristles on the finish.

title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Jory Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Elegant and aromatic, this 2013 offers light flavors of apple and raspberry, a dusting of cocoa and excellent balance. It does feel a bit thin as it fades out, but keeps its definition and focus.
